modules.description: This module defines infix operators for composing and redirecting shell commands. It works with the `cmd` type to model shell pipelines, supporting operations like input/output redirection, command sequencing, and logical control flow. Concrete use cases include building complex shell command chains with redirects and conditional execution directly in OCaml.

This module enables composing and executing shell-like pipelines using a domain-specific language, supporting operations like process piping, input/output redirection, and conditional command sequencing. It centers on a process representation type, working with strings, files, and environment settings through functions that mirror Unix utilities (e.g., `grep`, `ls`, `sed`) and advanced stream manipulation (e.g., line filtering, fuzzy finding with `fzf`). Typical use cases include building complex command chains programmatically, processing text streams with transformations, and automating system tasks with synchronous or asynchronous execution models.
